channel.description: Recent content in Eks on Tech Medley

item.title: K9s and How I Loved Exploring Kubernetes Again
item.description: I use kubenetes regularly, and most of the time I cannot remember what command to run let say to open shell into a container or to list the current containers and so. kubectl command is very powerful but also very very verbose :) k9s is the perfect tool for me as it make these command super easy to run the following (and much more) with one keystoke: Open a shell in a container.
